WRITING.TEXT: People who work on a regular basis hate him!

I went back and reexamined my sources (the people on Coursera's Learning How to Learn course) and I misunderstood. They just said you have to switch from focused to relaxed/diffused mode of thinking, nothing was mentioned of being aware of the moment. Guess I'll try to be more mindful during the times I relax and see ho that works out.

That's a great way to hinder your ability to learn and process information as well as impair your ability to think creatively as the brain needs downtime to process all activities mentioned above.
EDIT: Mindfulness is great and I'd recommend it to everyone but our mind isn't made to keep 100% track of what's going on all the time.

Been doing coursera's course Learning How to Learn and mindmaps get mentioned at one point:
+ great for recall after you took some time previously to learn the material
- horrible for first time learning
If you're gonna use them don't do it the first time you study something. Big plus is that they're fun to do.
thank you for replying so fast :D
Any sites you'd recommend for planning trips?
What places have you visited?
Thanks man, always appreciate a positive attitude! Hope you continue like that :D

WRITING.TITLE: Good books, shows, videos or podcasts on how to write comedy?
WRITING.TEXT:
Hi guys. I'm looking for resources that would help me improve my comedy writing skills, do you have anything to recommend?
I already did 6 stand-up shows, 4 open mics and 2 gigs (stand up is very rare where I come from so even if you're kinda good word goes around fast).
My material is mostly really dark humor, "gallows humor" as you would say, and I would like do more than that. I can line up one liners for days but I'm having a lot of difficulty writing longer bits or connected jokes. Currently I'm just trying out new things but I would appreciate any kind of help.
Thanks in advance.
I liked your set, wouldn't fret about it too much. Keep on performing and trying new stuff, I dig it.
Unemployed! Gonna go back to crying now.
Isn't it boogey men or have I been mishearing it all this time.
If you'd like to try out a fun metroidvannia I'd recommend Guaccameele Super Turbo Championship Edition (that's the real full name).

Game looks fun but they could've made a different design choice there.

WRITING.TITLE: Can't get TV to recognize HDMI PC connection
WRITING.TEXT:
Hi there.
First the specs: Windows 8 64 bit, graphics card - GeForce GTX 650 Ti
TV: it's a Quadro LCD TV
I'm trying to display my PC on my TV using a HDMI cable but nothing I've tried so far seems to work.
Here are images of the cable and ports: http://imgur.com/a/HFAJd
I use the HDMI port in the first pic (second row, first one to the left). There's another smaller HDMI port in the second pic (last row on the right side) but I don't have a cable that can fit.
What seems to be the problem? Why can't my TV recognize my PC?
I've tried switching between HDMI and PC displays on my TV but that didn't work.

Thank you, will try it out.
EDIT 2: It worked

WRITING.TITLE: Need help with DotA2 not appearing on screen
WRITING.TEXT:
So when I launch DotA2 from my steam library the screen freezes and the game appears as it's running on the task bar.
The theme starts playing, I can also get invites, but I can't interact with the program. How do I fix this?

Not a question related to OP's original one.
I don't get the people commenting here. The OP wanted controversial questions, he got them.
Instead of upvoting the controversial ones and getting an actual discussion going, everything is being downvoted to hell.
I'm mostly surprised by the approach by those who answer. Yes, racism isn't cool, but instead of downvoting and belittling the one asking, which will only make him not listen to you, why not engage with him and explain your view?
This a good response, if you have a core that devours the map ES is viable as a mid (or offlaner).

There's this quote I think of every time I want to make a big change in my life: " You don't have to do anything with your life, just do something with your day. "
As others have already set, try out small changes and see what works.

This! This is what has been bothering me for a long time and I didn't know what it was.
My brain feels beaten down by work, yet I don't do that much. I'm on my phone when driving in a car (as a passenger), when on the bathroom or walking my dog (podcasts). Most of my time is spent on or with the internet. I didn't realize it till now.
There are many more factors for me being "burned out" but controlling what information gets in my brain better could do me good.
Thanks for the interesting viewpoint.
It looks like a still claw coming out of the gun.
I get that it's required by Sony, I'm guessing. Still a bit sad.
Great trailer, great game, that preorder can go die in hell.
Great trailer, that pre-order is horrible. Why lock out a fan favorite weapon?
Nah, it's ruined now. Someone else can try.
